Package com.dua3.utility.math.geometry

Class PathBuilder2f

java.lang.Object
com.dua3.utility.math.geometry.PathBuilder2f
public class PathBuilder2f extends Object
A builder class for Path2f instances.

      Moves the current position by a relative offset specified by the given x and y coordinates. This implicitly starts a new path.
      Parameters:
      x - the relative offset along the x-axis
      y - the relative offset along the y-axis
      Returns:

      Adds a line segment to the path, starting from the current position and extending to the position defined by the relative offset coordinates.
      Parameters:
      x - the relative offset along the x-axis from the current position
      y - the relative offset along the y-axis from the current position
      Returns:
      this PathBuilder2f instance

      NOTE: This implicitly starts a new path.
      Parameters:

    • arcTo

      public PathBuilder2f arcTo(Vector2f ep, Vector2f r, float angle, boolean largeArc, boolean sweep)
      Adds an arc segment to the path, defined by the endpoint, radii, angle, and arc flags.
      Parameters:
      ep - the endpoint of the arc segment
      r - the radii of the arc segment
      angle - the angle of the arc segment in degrees
      largeArc - if true, the arc should be greater than or equal to 180 degrees, otherwise less than 180 degrees
      sweep - if true, the arc should be drawn in a "clockwise" direction, otherwise in a "counterclockwise" direction
      Returns:
      this PathBuilder2f instance

    • arcRel

      public PathBuilder2f arcRel(Vector2f ep, Vector2f r, float angle, boolean largeArc, boolean sweep)
      Adds an arc segment to the path defined by a relative endpoint, radii, angle, and arc flags from the current position of the path.
      Parameters:
      ep - the relative endpoint of the arc segment from the current position
      r - the radii of the arc segment on both x and y axes
      angle - the rotation angle of the arc segment in degrees
      largeArc - if true, the arc should be greater than or equal to 180 degrees, otherwise, it should be less than 180 degrees
      sweep - if true, the arc should be drawn in a "clockwise" direction, otherwise, it should be drawn in a "counterclockwise" direction
      Returns:
      this PathBuilder2f instance

    • curveTo

      public PathBuilder2f curveTo(Vector2f cp, Vector2f ep)
      Add a quadratic Bézier curve from the current position to a new position.

      The curve starts at the current position and ends at ep-

      Parameters:
      cp - the control point
      ep - the end point
      Returns:
      this instance

    • curveTo

      public PathBuilder2f curveTo(Vector2f cp1, Vector2f cp2, Vector2f ep)
      Add a cubic Bézier curve from the current position to a new position.

      The curve starts at the current position (p0) and ends at p3.

      Parameters:
      cp1 - first control point
      cp2 - second control point
      ep - end control point
      Returns:
      this instance

    • closePath

      public PathBuilder2f closePath()
      Close the current path by appending a line from the current position to the path's starting position.

      Notes

      • this method does not affect the number of vertices in this path
      • the current position is set to the start of the path
      • the path is reset when new segments are added to it after calling this method
      Returns:
      this instance

    • build

      public Path2f build()
      Builds a Path2f instance using the current state of the PathBuilder2f.
      Returns:
      a new instance of Path2f representing the constructed path

    • isEmpty

      public boolean isEmpty()
      Checks if the path is empty, meaning it contains no vertices.
      Returns:
      true if the path is empty, false otherwise
